Articles.Content:
I finally joined the forums after playing KSP for at least a year and a half (I still remember landing on the Mun in the demo). I love this game and just recently built a new desktop to play at maximum graphics settings, no longer limited by laptop performance!

I'm not sure if I'll be asking too many questions, but at least I don't have a reason not to contribute comments in interesting discussions anymore. See you out there in orbit!
Hello valaise and welcome to our forum. If you've been playing for 1.5 years, maybe you can answer questions rather than ask them.
Welcome, valaise! Ah yes, I also remeber landing on the Mun in the demo, tricky stuff. Fun stuff. I started playing in .19, a little over a year ago. See you round the forums!
when I landed on the mun in the demo, my engine fell of and I had a full tank of fuel and no way to use it. I never got around to rescuing Jeb.

when I landed on the mun in the demo, my engine fell of and I had a full tank of fuel and no way to use it. I never got around to rescuing Jeb.

Yes! I did the same thing, then followed with my first rescue mission. Landing at the same point on the Mun after you just figured out how to get to the surface of the Mun was quite the learning experience.

I'll admit that I did not know how to use maneuver nodes at the time either...
